p.An interdisciplinary minor that offers s: An interdisciplinary minor that offers students a background of the history, literature, languages, art, music, and philosophy of the Middle Ages and Renaissance.

li.Students are responsible for meeting any: Students are responsible for meeting any prerequisites for the courses in the minor, although they may individually petition instructors for permission to override these prerequisite requirements.

courseSection0.text:
An interdisciplinary minor that offers students a background of the history, literature, languages, art, music, and philosophy of the Middle Ages and Renaissance.
Minor Admission Requirements
None
Minor Requirements
None
Prerequisite Courses
Students are responsible for meeting any prerequisites for the courses in the minor, although they may individually petition instructors for permission to override these prerequisite requirements.

li.ENL 4341 - Milton and His Age Credit Hou: ENL 4341 - Milton and His Age Credit Hours:3  1
li.EUH 3122 - Medieval Society and Civiliza: EUH 3122 - Medieval Society and Civilization Credit Hours:3
li.HUM 3435 - Medieval Humanities Credit Ho:
HUM 3435 - Medieval Humanities Credit Hours:3
1 Only one of these three courses will count towards required courses
li.A list of approved restricted elective c: A list of approved restricted elective courses is found in the myKnight audit.
li.Select no more than two courses from a s: Select no more than two courses from a single disciplinary group:
li.ARH 4310 - Italian Renaissance Art Credi: ARH 4310 - Italian Renaissance Art Credit Hours: 3

li.Earn a grade of \"C\" (2.0) or better in: Earn a grade of "C" (2.0) or better in all courses used to satisfy the minor.
li.At least 12 hours used in the minor must: At least 12 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the College of Arts and Humanities.
li.No more than 6 hours can overlap with co: No more than 6 hours can overlap with courses used to satisfy the English major.
li.Course substitutions may be accepted upo: Course substitutions may be accepted upon approval of the advisor.
